title: Prominence Level Rendering Hints
description: Rendering hints that indicate the visual prominence level for content (1-5 scale)

1.name: Subtle
1.visualGuidance: Very subtle styling (light gray text, small size changes)
1.accessibility: May be skipped by screen readers in summary mode

2.name: Mild
2.description: Light visual emphasis, noticeable but not distracting
2.visualGuidance: Gentle styling changes (slightly different color, minor size increase)
2.accessibility: Read by screen readers but with lower priority

3.name: Normal
3.description: Standard prominence level, typical content emphasis
3.visualGuidance: Standard content styling with moderate emphasis

4.name: Strong
4.description: High visual emphasis, clearly stands out
4.visualGuidance: Strong styling (bold colors, larger text, borders)
4.accessibility: Higher priority for screen readers, may be announced

5.name: Critical
5.description: Maximum visual emphasis, impossible to miss
5.visualGuidance: Maximum styling (bright colors, large text, animations)
5.accessibility: Highest priority, may interrupt screen reader flow

html.4: Strong: font-weight: bold, color: primary, border-left: 3px solid
html.5: Critical: background: alert color, font-size: 1.2em, padding: large

pdf.1: Light gray text, smaller font size
pdf.4: Bold text, possible border or background
pdf.5: Large bold text, colored background, possible icon

docx.4: Strong character style or paragraph style

screenReader.1: aria-level='1' or skip in summary mode

cognitiveLoad.1: Low cognitive load - can be safely ignored
cognitiveLoad.5: Critical cognitive load - demands immediate attention
